author: killari.
content: I have been reading about cryptographic accumulators (eg, RSA). They appear to be superior to Merkle trees in many ways. Is there some reason why they are not used more in the space? I think there's something I am missing about them? They are more complex than Merkle and the accumulator needs to be bigger than 256 bits to have the same security as an equivalent Merkle tree, but are those the only downsides?
